title: Kyrgyz Republic
subtitle: Pearl of Central Asia
natureDesc: Kyrgyzstan is a mountainous country, 90% of which is covered by mountains. It is home to the famous Issyk-Kul Lake — the second largest alpine lake in the world. The country is known for its picturesque gorges, alpine meadows and majestic peaks of the Tien Shan.
climateDesc: Kyrgyzstan has a continental climate with four distinct seasons. Due to the mountainous terrain, the climate varies from region to region. In the valleys, summers are hot and dry, winters are moderately cold. In the mountains, the weather is cooler year-round.
bishkekSubtitle: Modern city at the foot of the Tien Shan mountains
bishkekDesc1: Bishkek is the capital and largest city of the Kyrgyz Republic. The city is located in the picturesque Chui Valley at the foot of the majestic Ala-Too range. Bishkek combines Soviet architecture with modern buildings, wide avenues with cozy parks.
bishkekDesc2: The city is the political, economic, scientific and cultural center of the country. It concentrates the largest universities, research institutes, theaters and museums. Bishkek is known for its green parks, numerous cafes and restaurants, as well as active student life.
educationDesc: Kyrgyzstan offers quality higher education at affordable prices with diplomas recognized in many countries around the world.
affordableDesc: Reasonable prices for education and accommodation compared to other countries
internationalDesc: Diplomas are recognized in CIS countries, Asia and many other regions
medicalDesc: Strong medical universities with practical training
safetyDesc: Peaceful environment and friendly attitude towards international students
afterArrival: Upon Arrival : What You Need to Know ?
arrivalControlDesc: Prepare your passport, invitation for study, and visa. Officials may clarify the purpose of your visit.
luggageDesc: After passport control, proceed to the baggage claim area. If your luggage is lost, immediately contact the Lost & Found service.
exchangeDesc: There are 24-hour exchange offices inside the airport. It's recommended to exchange a small amount for transport and food.
simDesc: Beeline, Megacom, and O! operators work in the arrival zone. Connection takes 5–10 minutes.
transportDesc: Several options are available: official Manas taxi or bus No. 380 (the cheapest option).
accommodationDesc: If the university provides a dormitory, follow the address in the invitation. Otherwise, you can temporarily stay in a hostel/hotel.
registrationDesc: International students must register within 5 days. Usually the university helps with registration.
visitUniversityDesc: At the university you need to: provide original documents, sign a contract, get a student ID, and undergo a medical examination.
